query: Dunoon Dirt Dash gravel race Dunoon

videos.title: Dunoon Dirt Dash Bikepacking Gravel Event I   Adventure Cycling in the Scottish Highlands
videos.description:
Adventure cycling off-road bikepacking and gravel biking at the Dunoon Dirt Dash. I rode this two-day event with a GoPro and this is my personal view.

Event: http://dirtdash.cc/dunoon/
Story & kit list: https://simon-willis.blogspot.com/2019/09/video-dunoon-dirt-dash-2019-2-day.html
Route Day 1: https://www.komoot.com/tour/96898431?ref=wtd
Route Day 2: https://www.komoot.com/tour/96898836?ref=wtd


SUPPORT
Join the Crew: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuSEN52fnqKmD99JkfexTGA/join
Buy me a Kofi: https://ko-fi.com/sunartmedia

FOLLOW
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/always_another_adventure/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AlwaysAnotherAdventure
Maps & rides on Komoot: https://www.komoot.com/user/alwaysanotheradventure
Strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/1231296

MY VIDEO KIT https://tinyurl.com/myvideokit 

MY CYCLING & CAMPING KIT https://tinyurl.com/mycyclingkit

[Applause]
this is the very first denoon dirt -
it's the partner event to the Dorset
dirt - except this one is it the
opposite end of the UK in Scotland
so what's it really like
I'm fine how are you Laurie glorious
it's a wonderful day for it
14 miles of beautiful views in this is
where the off-road starts there are only
two rules to this event the first one is
it's not a race
the second is don't be a Edie
we'd been warned there'd be hiker bike
if you expected a couple of hours of
pushing and carrying up a long boggy
tsuki hillside so this is an important
consideration when deciding what kit to
bring and how to pack it on your bike
there are times when it really is easier
to put the bike on your shoulder doesn't
feel easier I'm betting you don't see
that on the official video I do like
this it's not a bloody race
should say I'm well off route made a
mistake of following people then looking
at the GPS

Botanical Gardens for a cafe lunch we'd
stop here again tomorrow after all it's
not a race
it's tray after lunch tea but it was
short and led to some forest trails a
quiet coastal road which came to an end
leaving just forest roads and single
track as a way of continuing around the
coast considering there are 60 people
doing this and rather surprised that I'd
been alone for about an hour from well

wrong I was near the front because most
of the fast riders had stopped at the
pub we were aiming for an unmissable

castle unlike normal bike packing stoves
could be left at home venison burgers
chips and a veggie option provided by
Winston Churchill yes that is his name
the main topic of conversation that
night the morning hiker bike
next morning it was a race to breakfast
at one of the most idyllic ly placed
cafes I've seen stock up here
the big crime came early Hika bike again
but mixed with some riding and hiking
and riding you get the idea
at least this time there was a rideable
track on the other side with a cracking
descent this is temptation because
denoon is that way on the main road just
a few miles so you could bail out as you
hit this main road partway through day 2
I'm gonna press on
there are three parts to this day the
first was up and over the second is a
long forest track down the side of a
lock we're quick riders can zoom all the
way to bend more Gardens cafe again for
lunch there are some huge trees in these
Botanical Gardens gazing down on the
commercial conifers with a justified air
of superiority end of part 2 and
temptation yet again just had lunch in
the same cafe as yesterday and we know
there's an even shorter way back to the
noon there and my Garmin says the fall
of today's six climbs still lie ahead
but opressing by now though the climbs
come easy and roll under the wheels I'm
on the last time of the day so let's
knock out some thoughts
today's hiker bike was fine there was
only one short steep bit where you had
to carry the rest of the pushing wasn't
too steep and it was interspersed with
cycling none of that could really have
been said for yes to this hiker bike
which frankly was excessive good day I
think yesterday's hiker bike may put
some people off attempting this route II
and that would be fair enough you
shouldn't do it if you really want to
try to ride the whole thing you won't
the atmosphere here though could not be
faulted and I have to say this was a
superb route for me and an absolutely
fantastic event oh that that was good
today was lovely enjoy today
be a little more challenging watch
exploratory cycling on the Isle of Mull
here and more bike packing videos here
I'm Simon Willis thanks for watching and
subscribing
you

videos.title: Dunoon Dirt Dash 2019
videos.description:
The Dunoon Dirt Dash. Back on 26/27 September with more smiles! This year we had riders from across the UK, including Steve Bate MBE, Double Paralympic Champion and World Champion, Jon Gildea, Double Paralympic World Champion, and Jenny Tough, the first woman to finish the Silk Road Mountain Race. More information & entries at http://www.dirtdash.cc/dunoon

Video produced by FoSho Video https://foshovideo.com/

videos.title: SURLY DUNOON DIRT DASH - IT'S NOT A BLOODY RACE
videos.description:
Surly was kind enough to invite me to the inaugural Surly Dunoon Dash, a two-day bikepacking event starting and finishing in Dunoon on the west coast of Scotland. Super chill ride with a great group of people, would thoroughly recommend taking part if you get the chance. This is day one of the ride, more bikepacking fun to be had on day two here https://youtu.be/HhpiErY2ZyE. 

△ If you want to read more about the Surly Dunoon Dirt Dash, check out the ride report and pictures on my blog at https://mostlybybike.com/2019/10/08/surly-dunoon-dirt-dash/

△ Full event details can be found on the Dirt Dash website http://dirtdash.cc/dunoon/

△ Follow me on: 
• https://www.instagram.com/mostly_by_bike
• https://mostlybybike.com
• https://twitter.com/mostlybybike

△ Music:
• “Episode # 298” by CHANCES WITH WOLVES (https://www.chanceswithwolves.com/)

#mostlybybike #dunoondirtdash #bikepacking

videos.title: Dunoon Dirt Dash
videos.description: A short video of my ride in Dunoon, Scotland at the Dirt Dash 2023. Great riding with some fantastic views.

videos.title: Dunoon Dirt Dash - dirtdash cc
videos.description: Two of British Cycling's Para Cycling Team, Steve Bate and Jon Gildea ride the first ever Dunoon Dirt Dash. A two day Gravel/Road bike packing event  around Argyll's picture perfect gravel riding wonderland.
